class TypeManager

Detailed Description

Class to store the definition of an emitted object.

This class holds user-supplied objects such as function pointers, which are used to implement the functionality required for a object to be handled by bulletscript.

Retrieve the indices of control functions and Affectors that an emit call has specified.

This is used in semantic checking during compilation. It for is internal use.

node the ParseTreeNode in the abstract syntax tree.
callName the name of the control function, if any.
funcIndex the index of the control function, returned via reference.

int BS_NMSP::EmitType::getPropertyIndex ( const String &  name  )  const

Get the index of the named property.

Different EmitTypes may have properties with the same name. This is awkward, because control functions are EmitType-agnostic, and have no knowledge of what EmitType they may act on. Thus, when the function generates bytecode to use a property, it does not know the index of the property to use. This is therefore resolved at runtime by storing all possible property names in a global list and using the index into that list, then querying the EmitType at runtime to find out the actual index of the property. Todo: speed this up.

Parameters:
name name of the property to retrieve.
Returns:
the index of the property, or -1 if it does not exist.

int BS_NMSP::EmitType::getType (  )  const

Returns the unique EmitType ID.

Returns:
the type ID.

ScriptState &  state,
bstype  x,
bstype  y,
bstype *  members 
)

Process a BC_EMIT opcode.

This is used during runtime interpretation. It for is internal use.

Parameters:
code bytecode array.
state script record to be used.
x x-position of the emitting object.
y y-position of the emitting object.
members the member variables of the emitting object.
Returns:

void BS_NMSP::EmitType::registerAffector ( const String &  name,
AffectorFunction  func 
)

Registers a user AffectorFunction with this type.

Affector functions are stored per-EmitType. If the name is already in use, it will be overwritten.

Parameters:
name name of the function in script.
func AffectorFunction function pointer.

bool BS_NMSP::EmitType::registerEmitFunction ( const String &  name,
int  numArgs,
EmitFunction  func 
)

Register a user-supplied EmitFunction.

This lets the user give a named EmitFunction to be used in script. The number of arguments is required for semantic checking during compilation.

Parameters:
name the name of the function in script.
numArgs the number of arguments it takes (in script).
func pointer to the supplied EmitFunction
Returns:
false if the named function already exists, true otherwise.

bool BS_NMSP::EmitType::registerProperty ( const String &  name,
SetFunction  set,
GetFunction  get 
)

Register a controllable property for this EmitType.

You can only set BS_MAX_PROPERTIES properties, defined in bsConfig.h, due to performance reasons.

Parameters:
name property name.
set user-defined SetFunction.
get user-defined GetFunction.
Returns:
false if the property already exists, or there are too many properties, true otherwise.

void BS_NMSP::EmitType::setDieFunction ( DieFunction  func  ) 

Give the EmitType a user-defined DieFunction callback, for destroying emitted objects.

Unlike EmitFunctions, there can only be one DieFunction registered per EmitType.

Parameters:
func pointer to the function.

void BS_NMSP::EmitType::setProperty1 ( EmitTypeControl *  record,
const String &  prop,
bstype  value 
) const

void BS_NMSP::EmitType::setProperty2 ( EmitTypeControl *  record,
const String &  prop,
bstype  value,
bstype  time 
) const

Interpolate a property on an emitted object smoothly over time.

This uses the user-supplied SetFunction to set the named property.

Parameters:

prop the name of the property.
value the new value to set it to.
